channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16821] Enhance LoadIncrementalHFiles API to convey missing hfiles if any
item.description:
When map parameter of run() method is not null:


  public int run(String dirPath, Map<byte[], List<Path>> map, TableName tableName) throws Exception{

the caller knows the exact files to be bulk loaded.

This issue is to enhance the run() API so that when certain hfiles turn out to be missing, the return value should indicate the missing files.
item.summary: Enhance LoadIncrementalHFiles API to convey missing hfiles if any

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Ran the hung tests with patch:


Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHTableMultiplexer

Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 22.306 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHTableMultiplexer

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestMobCloneSnapshotFromClient

Tests run: 5, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 222.763 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestMobCloneSnapshotFromClient

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFromClientSide

Tests run: 80, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 4, Time elapsed: 290.082 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFromClientSide

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestReplicaWithCluster

Tests run: 4, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 68.388 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestReplicaWithCluster

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestMasterObserver

Tests run: 9, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 66.269 sec - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestMasterObserver

The tests are not related to bulk load.

private Pair<Multimap<ByteBuffer, LoadQueueItem>, List<String>> groupOrSplitPhase(

Update the javadoc for this method.


protected Pair<List<LoadQueueItem>, String> groupOrSplit(

You are changing the return type of protected api in a public audience class, is this ok ? Why not add another method instead and keep the existing as it is.


public List<String> run(String dirPath, Map<byte[], List<Path>> map, TableName tableName)

Let it return int only like the other run api, you can move the below logic here.


List<String> missing = run(dirPath, null, tableName);

if (missing == null) return 0;

return -1;

Suggest to have a better variable name than missing, may be missingHFiles or something else.

For groupOrSplit(), it is the last of calls (lowest level) where FileNotFoundException detection is placed.
If another method is added, parameter list must be different. API would look unclean.
It is protected, not public. It should be fine to do the refactor.

public List<String> run(String dirPath, Map<byte[], List<Path>> map, TableName tableName)

The above is not in branch-1. Meaning it is new public method. We can change its return type.

you can move the below logic here.

Can you clarify ?
The new run method needs to return missing hfiles.
Patch v2 addresses missingHFiles rename and javadoc addition.

List<String> missing = run(dirPath, null, tableName);

You can rename here too on commit.

-1 overall
